transcriptRaw:
Sam: Hey, have you guys seen that the Perseverance rover landed on Mars? It's so cool that we're exploring space like that.

Rachel: Yeah, I saw that on the news. It's amazing to think about all the new discoveries we might make on Mars.

Arnold: I've always been fascinated by space. The idea that there could be other planets with life forms out there is mind-blowing.

Sam: Definitely! And the universe is so vast, it's hard to even comprehend how much there is to explore.

Rachel: I remember when we visited the planetarium last year. It was incredible to learn about different galaxies and the possibility of other habitable planets.

Arnold: I wish we could travel to space one day. Imagine experiencing zero gravity and seeing Earth from up there.

Sam: Yeah, that would be an unforgettable experience. But for now, it's exciting to see all the advancements in space technology and exploration.

Rachel: I agree. I can't wait to see what else we discover about space in the future. It's such a fascinating and mysterious frontier.

1.text: Hey, have you guys seen that the Perseverance rover landed on Mars? It's so cool that we're exploring space like that.
1.textPhonetics: ˈheɪ həv juː ɡaɪz siːn ðæt ðə ˌpɜːrsəˈvɪərəns ˈroʊvər ˈlændɪd ɒn mɑrz ɪts soʊ kuːl ðæt wiːr ɪksˈplɔrɪŋ speɪs ˈlaɪk ðæt.

2.text: Yeah, I saw that on the news. It's amazing to think about all the new discoveries we might make on Mars.
2.textPhonetics: jæ sɔːd ðæt ɒn ðə nuz ɪts əˈmeɪzɪŋ tə ˈθɪŋk ʌˈbaʊt ɔːl ðə nuː dɪsˈkʌvəriz wiː maɪt meɪk ɒn mɑrz.

3.text: I've always been fascinated by space. The idea that there could be other planets with life forms out there is mind-blowing.
3.textPhonetics: aɪv ˈɔːlz wɪn ˈfæsɪˌneɪtəd baɪ speɪs ðə ˈaɪdiə ðæt ðer kʊd bi ˈəðər ˈplænɪts wɪð laɪf fɔːrmz aʊt ˈðɛr ɪz maɪnˈbloʊɪŋ.

4.text: Definitely! And the universe is so vast, it's hard to even comprehend how much there is to explore.
4.textPhonetics: ˈdɛfənɪtli. ənd ðə ˈjuːnɪˌvɜːrs ɪz soʊ ˈvæst ɪts ˈhɑrd tə ˈiːvən ˌkɒmprɪˈhɛnd haʊ ˈmʌtʃ ðer ɪz tə ɪksˈplɔr.

5.text: I remember when we visited the planetarium last year. It was incredible to learn about different galaxies and the possibility of other habitable planets.
5.textPhonetics: aɪ rɪˈmɛmbər ˈwɛn wiː ˈvɪzɪtəd ðə ˌplænɪˈteəriəm ˈlæst jɪr ɪt wəz ɪnˈkrɛdəbəl tə lɜːrn əˈbaʊt ˈdɪfərənt ˈɡælək͟siz ənd ðə ˌpɒsəˈbɪləti əv ˈəðər ˈhæbɪtəbəl ˈplænɪts.

6.text: I wish we could travel to space one day. Imagine experiencing zero gravity and seeing Earth from up there.
6.textPhonetics: aɪ ˈwɪʃ wiː kʊd ˈtrævəl tə speɪs wʌn ˈdeɪ. ɪˈmæʒən ɪksˈpɪriənsɪŋ ˈziːroʊ ˈɡrævɪti ənd ˈsiːɪŋ ɜːrθ frʌm ʌp ˈðɛr.

7.text: Yeah, that would be an unforgettable experience. But for now, it's exciting to see all the advancements in space technology and exploration.
7.textPhonetics: jeˈæ ˈðæt wʊd bi ən ˌʌn.fɚˈɡɛtəbəl ɪksˈpɪriəns. bʌt fər ˈnaʊ ɪts ɪkˈsaɪtɪŋ tə siː ɔːl ðə ədˈvɑːnsmənts ɪn speɪs tɛkˈnɒlədʒi ənd ˌɪkspləˈreɪʃən.

8.text: I agree. I can't wait to see what else we discover about space in the future. It's such a fascinating and mysterious frontier.
8.textPhonetics: aɪ əˈɡriː. aɪ kænt weɪt tə siː wʌt ɛls wiː dɪsˈkʌvər əˈbaʊt speɪs ɪn ðə ˈfjuːtʃər ɪts ˈsʌʧ ə ˈfæsəˌneɪtɪŋ ənd mɪsˈtɪrɪəs ˈfrʌntɪr.

transcriptPhonetics:

Sam: ˈdɛfənɪtli. ənd ðə ˈjuːnɪˌvɜːrs ɪz soʊ ˈvæst ɪts ˈhɑrd tə ˈiːvən ˌkɒmprɪˈhɛnd haʊ ˈmʌtʃ ðer ɪz tə ɪksˈplɔr.

Rachel: aɪ rɪˈmɛmbər ˈwɛn wiː ˈvɪzɪtəd ðə ˌplænɪˈteəriəm ˈlæst jɪr ɪt wəz ɪnˈkrɛdəbəl tə lɜːrn əˈbaʊt ˈdɪfərənt ˈɡælək͟siz ənd ðə ˌpɒsəˈbɪləti əv ˈəðər ˈhæbɪtəbəl ˈplænɪts.

Sam: jeˈæ ˈðæt wʊd bi ən ˌʌn.fɚˈɡɛtəbəl ɪksˈpɪriəns. bʌt fər ˈnaʊ ɪts ɪkˈsaɪtɪŋ tə siː ɔːl ðə ədˈvɑːnsmənts ɪn speɪs tɛkˈnɒlədʒi ənd ˌɪkspləˈreɪʃən.

Rachel: aɪ əˈɡriː. aɪ kænt weɪt tə siː wʌt ɛls wiː dɪsˈkʌvər əˈbaʊt speɪs ɪn ðə ˈfjuːtʃər ɪts ˈsʌʧ ə ˈfæsəˌneɪtɪŋ ənd mɪsˈtɪrɪəs ˈfrʌntɪr.
